result.execSummary:
The defendant Dewayne L Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and DNA surcharge waived due to low income.
**1/29/2016  Restitution set at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dewayne L Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Scanned:  Order to Produce signed on 1/20/2016.

Defendant Dewayne L Brown in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Restitution hearing proceeded. Sworn in for the Defense :  Dewayne B. Defense rests. State rests. Testimony closed. Court set restitution at Zero. Defendant is homeless and residing at a shelter.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 138 days  in the House of Correction,  with credit for 138 days time served. 

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample. Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and dna surcharge waived due to low income.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Dewayne L Brown in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Dewayne L Brown in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of doctor's report indicating defendant is competent. No corrections or addition. All parties stipulate to the findings. Court makes the findings that the defendant is competent to proceed.  Restitution hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Dr. Dawn Laurent's report dated 1/13/2016, received and filed
Court signed order for the Defendant to be transported and admitted into a mental health institution desinated by the Department of Health Sevices   FORTHWITH. Copies given to the parties. lr

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Dewayne L Brown not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

 Defendant refused to come to court, therefore the defense counsel finds defendant is standing mute.  All parties in receipt of doctor's report. No corrections or additions. All parties in agreement with the findings that the defendant is Not Competent , but Likely to Become Competent with Treatment. 
  The court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period  if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 9 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The court ordered defendant  committed  to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 9 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. Court ordered defendant REMANDED INTO THE CUSTODY OF MILWAUKEE COUNT SHERIFF'S DEPT. TO BE TRANSPORTED TO MENDOTA.     Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.
Case adjourned to  1-27-16  at 1:30 p.m. for review hearing  in Branch 47.  Review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Doctor's report received and filed.
Signed and filed.

Defendant Dewayne L Brown in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Dewayne L Brown in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  No challenge to report authored by Dr. Deborah Collins requesting in-patient evaluation.  Defendant pleds the "fifth".  Parties address public defender representation and defendant being cooperative with counsel.  Attorney Araiza to represent the defendant.  The Court orders the defendant remanded.  Order provided to deputy sheriff for the purpose of transport.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Report by Dr. Deborah L. Collins received and filed with court.

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 9-19-15.
Bench warrant in file.

Defendant Dewayne L Brown in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Dewayne L Brown in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Justice point discharge summary received and filed. lr
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr
Received and Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report; Missed Office Contact.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Aurora St. Luke's Medical Center (the entire complex and the grounds) located at 2900 W. Oklahoma Ave., Milwaukee, WI

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Standard Supervision.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dewayne L Brown in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Dewayne L Brown in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
